snippet: A show about Gertrude Stein’s family as art patrons is coming to the Met. Also: paintings by Walter De Maria at the Menil Collection and Bomb Magazine’s Web site is posting more material by and about artists.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Metropolitan Museum of Art exhibit The Steins Collect: Matisse, Picasso and the Parisian Avant-Garde will showcase works collected by Gertrude Stein and her brothers Leo and Michael, who were major patrons and collectors of their age; Menil Collection in Houston says it has bought two paintings by artist Walter De Maria, who is best known for his sculptures and earthwork; Bomb Magazine, quarterly forum for artists of all disciplines, is in the process of digitizing its archives.
lead_paragraph: A show about Gertrude Stein’s family as art patrons is coming to the Met. Also: paintings by Walter De Maria at the Menil Collection and Bomb Magazine’s Web site is posting more material by and about artists.

headline.seo: Met Show Focuses on Gertrude Stein’s Family as Art Patrons
headline.main: Paying Another Visit to the Stein Salon
headline.print_headline: Paying Another Visit To the Stein Salon
